channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Has been there for several weeks. Outside 77 Danby Street SE15 4BT.

item.title: Over flow of sewage pipe into high street pavement, 17th July
item.description:
Hello, I would like to inform you that there is an overflow of sewage from a pipe outside number 36-38 Bromley high street that been going on for weeks now and it is affecting all the businesses next to it and damaging the shops floor. If you could please try and do something to help? Kind regards, The Bromley Barber shop Manager Kind regards, The B

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, High Street, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Quasar civils dumped various bags, 17th July
item.description:
A small open backed lorry owned by Quasar Civils Road and Rail deposited about 6 bags of assorted rubbish behind the recycle collection pods at corner of upper park road and erith road. At 9.06pm on Wednesday 16/7/25. Two guys white in 20s removed from back of truck and left at site.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Washing Machine and Mattress abandoned, 17th July
item.description:
There is an old white washing machine inside a brown cardboard box fly tipped alongside a double mattress. They are next to the bins outside of 59 - 73 John Wilson Street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Monk Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uncollected, overflowing residential bins, 17th July
item.description:
The bins for the flats above the shops between 156 and 146 Plumstead Common Road, which are all accessed via Jago Close have not been emptied for weeks, rubbish is overflowing, and attacting rats and other pests. It is unhygienic for those who live and work in the area. the residents have attempted to rebag the spillages but the bins are not being collected.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jago Close, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trailer Dumped outside our business address since October 2024, 17th July
item.description:
Trailer has been dumped outside our business address since Oct 24. 3 tickets already raised - this sticker was placed on saying being removed November 2024 but still on street. It is blocking view of exit from our premises Can someone please contact me with an update
